job_description: • Execute production operations according to defined procedures and ensure the integrity and quality of our products Ability to operate and maintain laboratory to clean room standards required in the production of Life Science products Process work orders accurately using an ERP system in a timely manner Maintenance of production batch records and good documentation under ISO requirement Accurate tracking of production data, test data and inventory Assembly of 10x consumables and finished goods both manually and using semi-automated packaging equipment Ability to set up and operate packaging equipment and handle simple troubleshooting Perform preventive maintenance on some lab equipment Provide feedback to improve process quality and efficiency Identify issues occurring in production labs and escalate issues to supervisor’s or MSE’s attention High school education / Associate Degree or above Strong team player and detail oriented Good communication skills Ability to read and understand SOPs and equipment user manual Ability to enter data into electronic tracking systems like Excel Ability to multi-task and prioritize work load to meet strict deadlines under supervision Good documentation skills and ability to write procedures and reports Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization and taking products and processes to the next level Ability to lift up to 15 pounds and potentially stand or sit for up to 3 hour increments Experience in automation and packaging of Life Science products, Food Packaging products or related field preferred Relevant experience in a production environment working with standard production control tools – ERP, inventory control, and work orders Experience training employees on production processes defined in production batch records and work instructions Experience writing and revising work instructions and production batch records Experienced in communicating and collaborating with production • BS in Computer Science or Electrical or Computer Engineering (or equivalent experience) with 2+ years of CAD or software development experience.
• MS preferredSoftware engineering experience with software design, algorithms, data structures, testingFamiliarity with Verilog and ASIC implementation flow and toolsExperience developing flows and/or tools for chip designProficiency in at least one of Python, C/C++, Tcl, Perl Knowledge or experience with logic synthesis, physical design, formal equivalence checking.
• Experience in other ASIC methodologies such as RTL Lint, CDC, DFT or STA.
• Familiarity with Machine Learning/Deep Learning You will architect highly automated and customizable design software incorporating logic/physical synthesis, design planning, and equivalence checking for industry-leading chip designsApply software engineering practices to streamline development and automate testing and deployment of our software.
• Be responsible for design, implementation and testing of in-house CAD softwareWork with chip design teams and leading EDA vendors to evaluate the industry's most powerful design implementation and analysis toolsProvide support for ASIC tools and flows.
